DOCNAME: CASE OF MESUT YURTSEVER v. TURKEY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and taken into custody by police officers from the anti - terrorism branch of ORG on suspicion of membership of the ORG ( ORG of Kurdistan ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment against the applicant and CARDINAL others , accusing them , inter alia , of membership of an illegal armed organisation and of participating in separatist activities . The public prosecutor sought the death penalty for the applicant pursuant to LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of as charged and sentenced him to death , which sentence was later commuted to life imprisonment . The judgment was ex officio subject to appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted his written opinion to ORG , in which he had argued that ORG should quash the applicant 's conviction on account of the severity of the sentence imposed on the applicant . He opined that the applicant should have been sentenced pursuant to LAW , which punishes membership of an illegal organisation , instead of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing , differed with the opinion of ORG , and upheld the judgment of ORG . The applicant 's representative did not attend this hearing . The decision was pronounced in the absence of the applicant and his representative on DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice in force at the material time are outlined in the PERSON v. GPE judgment ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § DATE , ORG CARDINALV ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE Article CARDINAL of LAW was amended to provide that the written opinion of the principal public prosecutor at ORG be notified to the parties .
